backend/main.mo: Main Motoko actor implementing emergency response system with help requests, user profiles, chat messages, role-based access control (citizens and officers), and methods for SOS requests, accepting/resolving emergencies, and messaging.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report mapping implemented features (landing page, dual authentication, registration, location access, help requests, officer dashboard, etc.) to their source files, components, and test IDs with confidence levels.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Pre-existing summaries of frontend files describing components for landing page, authentication, dashboards, emergency alerts, location handling, messaging, notifications, and styling with emergency services color palette.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind CSS configuration with custom CSS variables defining light and dark theme colors using OKLCH color system, including emergency services palette and sidebar styling.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point with viewport meta tag, page title 'Safety Alert Emergency Response Platform', root div, and module script loading main.tsx.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Root React component configuring TanStack Router with routes for landing, auth, citizen/officer dashboards, and request details, wrapped in ThemeProvider and including Toaster for notifications.
frontend/src/components/EmergencyAlertBu: Large circular emergency button component that triggers location permission modal, captures GPS coordinates via useGeolocation hook, sends SOS request to backend, and navigates to request detail page on success.
Card component displaying help request details (citizen name, phone, location, status, timestamp) with accept button for pending requests and view details navigation, using mutations for accepting requests.
frontend/src/components/Layout.tsx: Main application layout component with header, navigation, and footer. Handles authentication state, user profile display, role-based dashboard navigation, and logout functionality.
frontend/src/components/LocationPermissi: Modal dialog component that requests user permission for location access. Displays explanation for why location is needed and provides grant/deny buttons.
frontend/src/components/MessageThread.ts: Real-time messaging component for emergency requests. Displays message history in a scrollable area and allows sending new messages with keyboard shortcuts.
frontend/src/components/NotificationMana: Background component that monitors emergency requests and sends browser notifications to officers when new pending requests arrive. Requests notification permission on mount.
frontend/src/components/RegistrationForm: User registration form for citizens and officers. Collects name and mobile number with validation, then navigates to appropriate dashboard after successful registration.
frontend/src/components/RoleSelector.tsx: Role selection interface with two cards for choosing between citizen and officer roles. Provides visual distinction and descriptions for each role type.
frontend/src/components/StatusBadge.tsx: Reusable badge component that displays emergency request status (pending, accepted, resolved) with color-coded styling based on the status type.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Custom hook that manages backend actor creation with Internet Identity authentication. Handles actor initialization, admin token setup, and query invalidation when identity changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useGeolocation.ts: Custom hook for requesting and managing browser geolocation access. Handles permission states, loading states, errors, and returns location coordinates with high accuracy.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides React context and hooks for Internet Identity authentication, managing login state, identity persistence, and delegation validation with configurable AuthClient options.
frontend/src/hooks/useNotifications.ts: Custom hook for managing browser notifications, providing permission request functionality and methods to send notifications with support detection.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: React Query hooks for backend interactions including user profiles, SOS requests, help request management, and real-time chat messages with automatic polling and cache invalidation.
frontend/src/index.css: Tailwind CSS configuration with custom CSS variables for emergency-themed color palette (emergency red, police blue, safety green) and emergency-specific animations like pulse and glow effects.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that sets up React Query client and Internet Identity provider, then renders the root App component.
frontend/src/pages/AuthPage.tsx: Authentication page handling Internet Identity login flow, role selection (citizen/officer), and registration form display with automatic redirection based on user profile.
frontend/src/pages/CitizenDashboard.tsx: Citizen dashboard displaying emergency alert button, notification manager, and instructional cards explaining the emergency response workflow.
frontend/src/pages/LandingPage.tsx: Landing page component with hero section and features grid that routes authenticated users to appropriate dashboards (officer or citizen) based on their profile type.
frontend/src/pages/OfficerDashboard.tsx: Officer dashboard displaying emergency help requests in tabs (pending, active, resolved) with notification management and request filtering by status.
frontend/src/pages/RequestDetailPage.tsx: Detail view for individual emergency requests showing citizen info, location, status, and message thread with ability for officers to mark requests as resolved.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Utility functions for extracting and managing URL parameters from both query strings and hash-based routing, with sessionStorage persistence support.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration defining custom color schemes (emergency, police, safety themes), extended utilities, and design tokens using OKLCH color space.
project_state.json: Project configuration for an emergency response safety website connecting citizens with police officers through real-time alerts and location sharing. Defines architectural requirements including geolocation services, WebSocket notifications, RBAC, and lists seven existing features covering landing page, dual authentication, registration, location access, help requests, officer dashboard, and real-time notifications.
